attributes.action: recognise the achievements of Walter Tull, the first black army officer and footballer
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Walter Tull was one of the the first black footballers if not the first in the Premiership of the time  back in the early 1900s.  He endured much abuse but played at the highest level for clubs like at Tottenham Hotspur.  

More importantly, he was the first black officer in the British Army.  He worked his way up the ranks despite the institutional rules designed to prevent this.  He lead his men into battle and on various raids, being nominated for the military cross for bringing his men back unharmed during a mission.  He was  killed in battle.  

A truly British Hero whose rise against the odds and valour deserves to be recognised.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Ministry of Defence.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
